result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanner R. Emond

defendant.name: Emond, Tanner R.
defendant.address: 224 E Howard St; Apt 7, Portage, WI 53901

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Defendant Tanner R. Emond appeared by video, in custody from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video for Tanner R. Emond.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Sarbacker states that the defendant is serving a sentence on another case; requests another status date.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

3:26 PM Defendant Tanner R. Emond appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant did contact Atty Sarbacker yesterday to let him know he was turning himself in.  

Atty Burdon requests a $250 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant asks for $150 cash bond.  Defendant was homeless for a little while.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:28 AM Defendant Tanner R. Emond not in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video for Tanner R. Emond.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Sarbacker stated off the record that the court had sentenced the defendant in a different matter but he is not in custody in Columbia or Marquette County  Atty Sarbacker is unsure where his client is today.
Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.

2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner R. Emond appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Tanner R. Emond. 
Atty Sarbacker requests another status date and explains the reason.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner R. Emond by phone.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Tanner R. Emond. 
Atty Sarbacker just received an offer and defendant has another case in front of Judge Slate next week.  May handle all with him.
BY THE COURT:  Court has no objection but will set status.
Status hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner R. Emond appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video for Tanner R. Emond. 
Atty Sarbacker states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Sarbacker states that the defendant will waive time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

3:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner R. Emond appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant does qualify but he has not been able to speak to the defendant.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $250 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz makes bail arguments and asks for a signature bond or a $100 cash bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions: 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
